\\/D:\\/repos\\/stride-translations\\/pt: <g1>Normal maps<\/g1> are textures that add the appearance of surface detail, such as cracks and bumps, without changing the actual geometry of a model.
<g1>Normal maps<\/g1> são texturas que adicionam a aparência do detalhe da superfície, como rachaduras e colisões, sem alterar a geometria real de um modelo.
<g1>Normal maps<\/g1> are textures that add the appearance of surface detail, such as cracks and bumps, without changing the actual geometry of a model.
They contain information about how meshes should reflect light, creating the illusion of much more complex geometry.
Eles contêm informações sobre como as malhas devem refletir a luz, criando a ilusão de geometria muito mais complexa.
They contain information about how meshes should reflect light, creating the illusion of much more complex geometry.
This saves lots of processing power.
Isso economiza muito poder de processamento.
This saves lots of processing power.

(Imagens cortesia de Paolo Cignoni, compartilhadas sob <g2>Attribution-ShareAlike 1.0 Genérico (CC BY-SA 1.0)<\/g2>
<g1>(Images courtesy of Paolo Cignoni, shared under <g2>Attribution-ShareAlike 1.0 Generic (CC BY-SA 1.0)<\/g2><\/g1>
Normal maps usually represent small changes of the normal vector (the vector which points away from the surface).
Os mapas normais geralmente representam pequenas mudanças do vetor normal (o vetor que aponta para longe da superfície).
Normal maps usually represent small changes of the normal vector (the vector which points away from the surface).
Stride uses the most common convention: the X and Y components follow the tangent and the bitangent of the surface, and the Z component follows the normal vector of the surface.
O Stride usa a convenção mais comum: os componentes X e Y seguem o tangente e o benfeitor da superfície, e o componente Z segue o vetor normal da superfície.
Stride uses the most common convention: the X and Y components follow the tangent and the bitangent of the surface, and the Z component follows the normal vector of the surface.

This means that a value of <g1>(0, 0, 1)<\/g1> coincides with the normal vector and represents no change, while a value of <g2>(-1, 0, 0)<\/g2> tilts to the "left" (ie negative X value in the tangent (local) space).

Isso significa que um valor de <g1>(0, 0, 1)<\/g1> coincide com o vetor normal e não representa nenhuma mudança, enquanto um valor de <g2>(-1, 0, 0)<\/g2> inclina para a "esquerda" (ou seja, valor X negativo no espaço tangente (local).

This means that a value of <g1>(0, 0, 1)<\/g1> coincides with the normal vector and represents no change, while a value of <g2>(-1, 0, 0)<\/g2> tilts to the "left" (ie negative X value in the tangent (local) space).
In the <g1>Asset View<\/g1>, select the texture you want to use as a normal map.
No <g1>Asset View<\/g1>, selecione a textura que deseja usar como um mapa normal.
In the <g1>Asset View<\/g1>, select the texture you want to use as a normal map.
In the <g1>Property Grid<\/g1>, make sure the <g2>type<\/g2> is set to <g3>normal map<\/g3>.
No <g1>Property Grid<\/g1>, certifique-se de que o <g2>type<\/g2> está definido como <g3>normal map<\/g3>.
In the <g1>Property Grid<\/g1>, make sure the <g2>type<\/g2> is set to <g3>normal map<\/g3>.
This means Stride assumes the texture is in linear color space and converts it to a format suited for normal maps.
Isso significa que Stride assume que a textura está em espaço de cor linear e converte-a em um formato adequado para mapas normais.
This means Stride assumes the texture is in linear color space and converts it to a format suited for normal maps.
In the <g1>Asset View<\/g1>, select the material you want to use the normal map.
No <g1>Asset View<\/g1>, selecione o material que deseja usar o mapa normal.
In the <g1>Asset View<\/g1>, select the material you want to use the normal map.
In the <g1>Property Grid<\/g1>, under the material <g2>Geometry<\/g2> properties, expand <g3>Surface<\/g3>.
No <g1>Property Grid<\/g1>, sob o material <g2>Geometry<\/g2> propriedades, expanda <g3>Surface<\/g3>.
In the <g1>Property Grid<\/g1>, under the material <g2>Geometry<\/g2> properties, expand <g3>Surface<\/g3>.
Next to <g1>Normal map<\/g1>, click <x1\/>Blue arrow button<x2\/> (<g2>Replace<\/g2>) and make sure <g3>Texture<\/g3> is selected.
Próximo a <g1>Normal map<\/g1>, clique em <x1\/> Botão de seta azul<x2\/> (<g2> Substituir<\/g2>) e certifique-se de <g3>Textura<\/g3> é selecionado.
Next to <g1>Normal map<\/g1>, click <x1\/>Blue arrow button<x2\/> (<g2>Replace<\/g2>) and make sure <g3>Texture<\/g3> is selected.
Next to <g1>Normal map<\/g1>, click <x1\/>Hand icon<x2\/> (<g2>Select an asset<\/g2>).
Ao lado de <g1>Normal map<\/g1>, clique em <x1\/>Hand icon<x2\/> (<g2>Select an asset<\/g2>).
Next to <g1>Normal map<\/g1>, click <x1\/>Hand icon<x2\/> (<g2>Select an asset<\/g2>).
Select the normal map texture and click <g1>OK<\/g1>.
Selecione a textura normal do mapa e clique em <g1>OK<\/g1>.
Select the normal map texture and click <g1>OK<\/g1>.
For more information about materials, see <g1>Materials<\/g1>.
Para obter mais informações sobre materiais, consulte <g1>Materials<\/g1>.
For more information about materials, see <g1>Materials<\/g1>.
Normal map textures have two properties in addition to the <g1>common texture properties<\/g1>.
Texturas de mapas normais têm duas propriedades além das propriedades de textura <g1>common<\/g1>.
Normal map textures have two properties in addition to the <g1>common texture properties<\/g1>.
Have positive Y components (green pixels) face up in tangent space.
Tenha componentes Y positivos (pixéis verdes) enfrentam-se no espaço tangente.
Have positive Y components (green pixels) face up in tangent space.
This option depends on the tools you use to create normal maps.
Esta opção depende das ferramentas que você usa para criar mapas normais.
This option depends on the tools you use to create normal maps.
For information about normal map properties in materials, see <g1>Materials — Geometry attributes<\/g1>.
Para obter informações sobre propriedades normais de mapas em materiais, consulte <g1>Materials — Geometria atributos<\/g1>.
For information about normal map properties in materials, see <g1>Materials — Geometry attributes<\/g1>.
